page.title: 19STREET LIFE SERVICES
page.content:
'THE POSTMAN'. by Sarah Foreman Age 11.
We post our letters in a letter-box. When it comes to a certain time a postman comes to collect them and takes them to the Sorting Office in a van.Our nearest Sorting Office is in Church Street.At the Sorting Office, they sort the letters and parcels out into counties. Next they take that county and sort it out into towns and villages. Sometimes the letters are sorted out by electronic machines with the help of the post-code. That bag of letters and parcels go, either in a van or on a train,to that county's main Sorting Office where the letters are sorted out into towns.They,in turn, are delivered door to door by the postman on his daily rounds.
